Jotunn, in his mobile command center in Europe, monitored the various
Iron =
Skull assault around the world. The lesser outposts had been
easily snatche=
d and a lot of Bushidos had even jumped ship to
cooperate. Good. The bigger=
 one still had to be secured more
completely, but progress was showing at a=
 lot of places. Wherever the
Iron Skulls were underrepresented, though, the=
y had been easily
thwarted. But one battle was still running. The most impo=
rtant one and
the symbolic key to victory.

Relay.

Once the Parliament was=
 in his hands, the Maximals would be deeply
affected and their morale would=
 lose them, making the rest a matter of
numbers and military superiority fo=
r him. Things were going well.

*******

A Predacon bomber ran another pass=
 at the slowly rising Silver Wing
fortifications, destroying an accumulated=
 effort to pieces of
smoldering scrap. He was then chased by two lighter Ma=
ximals who tried
to shoot him down only to be terminated by the more prepar=
ed Preds
inside the Parliament.

Deadfur swore. This was a Coup, no mistake=
, and he realized the Skulls
had a lot to win by pulling this one off. They=
 had locked themselves
up, but the Silver Wings could seemingly not crack t=
hat tough nut.

Deadfur: Look, Razorwing, we don't have much of a choice. W=
e'll have
to blast the building open or something so as to really shake the=
ir
defenses down. I know they're prepared, but only for the obvious,
meanin=
g your style of combat. My suggestion is collateral damage. They
won't expe=
ct that from you.

He turned to Remus for an opinion, then back to Razorwin=
g.
